thread.title: Keeneland's Day at the Races: Lanerie closing in on jockey title
thread.title_full: Keeneland's Day at the Races: Lanerie closing in on jockey title

title: Keeneland's Day at the Races: Lanerie closing in on jockey title
text:
The Day at the Races 
Thursday's figures: On-track attendance, 10,686; on-track betting, $709,411; total betting including simulcast, $5,113,058. 
This day last year: On-track attendance, 9,715; on-track betting, $776,125; total betting including simulcast, $5,286,123. 
Coming up: There are no stakes races on Friday's 10-race card. Stakes racing returns on Saturday with the Grade III Pin Oak Valley View for 3-year-old fillies going 11⁄16 miles on the turf. 
Final furlong 
■ With Breeders' Cup Saturday taking place on Halloween, the annual appearance by the Headless Horseman at Keeneland will take place a week early. The Headless Horseman will make an appearance in the Paddock at 9 a.m. this Saturday, Oct. 24, and will appear on the main track during races later in the day. 
■ Salama, a contender for the Distaff, worked a half-mile in company in :48.60 for trainer Charles LoPresti after the morning renovation break. Fellow Distaff contender Yahilwa was also on the tab, working 5 furlongs in :59. 
Sprint hopeful Holy Lute worked a half-mile in :51.20 and Lady Shipman, who is pointing for the Turf Sprint, worked 5 furlongs before the break in 1:03.20. 
■ Jockey Corey Lanerie is inching closer to his first Keeneland meet title. Lanerie won two more races on Thursday's card to build a 20-16 lead over Julien Leparoux heading into the final two days of the meet. 
ALICIA WINCZE HUGHES
